skill.author: BPSAI

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation file (SKILL.md) with no executable code, scripts, or network operations. It describes release workflow procedures but does not contain any code that could execute, access files, or make network calls.

content.value_statement: Managing software releases requires following many steps correctly. This skill provides a structured 8-phase workflow to validate tests, update versions, verify documentation, and prepare git commits for safe releases.
actual_capabilities: Validates all sprint tasks are complete before release
Runs test suites and checks code coverage thresholds
Performs security scans for secrets and vulnerabilities
Updates version strings across multiple files
Verifies CHANGELOG, README, and FEATURE_MATRIX are current
Prepares git commits and annotated tags for release
limitations: Does not execute builds or deployments directly
Does not push to remote repositories or publish to package registries
Requires manual confirmation before git push operations
Does not roll back releases or handle failed release recovery

use_cases.title: Standardized Release Process
use_cases.description: Follow consistent release procedures across all releases with built-in validation gates and security checks

use_cases.title: Version Management
use_cases.description: Automatically update version strings in pyproject.toml, __init__.py, and configuration files

use_cases.title: Pre-Release Validation
use_cases.description: Verify tests pass, coverage meets targets, and no secrets exist before releasing

prompt_templates.title: Start Release
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the releasing-versions skill to prepare release v{version}. Start from Phase 1 and validate everything.

prompt_templates.title: Version Bump
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me bump the version from {current_version} to {new_version} using the releasing-versions workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-Release Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the pre-release validation phase from releasing-versions. Check tests, coverage, and security scans.

prompt_templates.title: Full Release Prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a complete release using all 8 phases of the releasing-versions skill. Show me the summary report.

output_examples.input: Prepare release v2.9.0 using the releasing-versions skill
output: Pre-Release Checks: All tasks complete, Tests: 127 passed, Coverage: 85%, Security: Clean
Documentation: CHANGELOG updated, README current, FEATURE_MATRIX updated
Build: Package built successfully, Installs cleanly, Version verified
Ready to Release: git push origin main && git push origin v2.9.0

best_practices: Run the full 8-phase workflow sequentially without skipping validation steps
Review security scan results carefully before proceeding to git operations
Always confirm the git push commands manually before executing them
anti_patterns: Skipping pre-release validation to speed up the release process
Proceeding with release when tests fail or coverage is below threshold
Not reviewing stale documentation warnings before committing

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides workflow guidance for release preparation.

faq.question: What version format should I use?
faq.answer: Use X.Y.Z format in files (without v prefix) and vX.Y.Z for git tags. Example: 2.9.0 in code, v2.9.0 as tag.

faq.question: Does this skill push to remote repositories?
faq.answer: No. The skill prepares git commits and tags but requires manual confirmation before git push operations.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using security scans?
faq.answer: Yes. Security scans run locally on your codebase. No data is sent to external services. Scans check for secrets and vulnerabilities.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail during validation?
faq.answer: Tests failing is a blocking condition. The release cannot proceed. Fix failing tests and re-run from Phase 1.

faq.question: How is this different from CI/CD tools?
faq.answer: This skill guides the AI through release procedures. CI/CD tools automate builds and deployments. Use both together for complete release automation.
